intro: Tambourissa crassa, commonly known as the thick-stemmed tambourissa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its robust, woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central column. Tambourissa crassa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
